articles.title: Joint Income Tax Returns for Married Couples: A Policy Shift Ahead?
articles.summary: At present, India’s income tax system is entirely based on individual taxation, wherein each taxpayer is entitled to a separate basic exemption limit and individual deductions. Even after marriage, there is no fundamental change in this structure. articles.title: 'Going to have a good deal': Trump on India-US trade deal, says has "great respect" for PM Modi
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump expressed confidence in an upcoming India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement, calling Prime Minister Narendra Modi a close friend and respected leader. Both nations are reportedly nearing a deal to significantly boost bilateral trade, aiming to reach $500 billion by 2030.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Fiscal policy to turn pro-growth as government moves to target debt-to-GDP, economists say
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: India's fiscal policy is set to favor growth as the government shifts its focus to a debt-to-GDP ratio target from April 2026. This move is expected to lead to a gentler pace of fiscal tightening. Economists anticipate gross borrowings to reach record highs, though net borrowings may remain stable, potentially impacting bond markets.

articles.title: India Budget 2026: Resilience balance - revenue miss, deficit unchanged
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: India's fiscal health is strong, with its deficit halved post-pandemic. The upcoming Budget 2026 will assess fiscal arithmetic and outline priorities. While nominal GDP growth is slower than budgeted, a stronger FY25 base offers comfort. Revenue misses are expected due to GST rationalisation and tax relief. Higher dividends will offset this.

Despite recent diplomatic overtures, Beijing's stance highlights a significant technology gap. India's 'Make in India' initiative struggles against this dominance.

articles.title: US revokes over 100,000 visas so far amid Trump crackdown; deportations to continue
articles.summary: America's State Department has cancelled over 100,000 visas this year. This action targets foreign nationals with criminal records or legal issues. The department states this is to keep America safe. This move affects tourists, students, and skilled workers. Indians, a large group of visa holders, are impacted. India is raising these concerns with Washington.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Top stories: Trump guns for Greenland at Davos, rupee hits record low, EU freezes US trade deal & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm

articles.title: Rupee could slide to 92.5-93 per dollar if pressure persists: ANZ’s Dhiraj Nim
articles.summary: Dhiraj Nim, Economist and FX Strategist at ANZ Research, attributed the rupee’s weakness to two key pressures: continued outflows from Indian markets amid visible stress from the ongoing earnings season and global risk jitters.

articles.title: Amagi Media sees revenue growth holding at 25-30% as cloud adoption rises
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs CEO Baskar Subramanian said the company expects to sustain 25–30% revenue growth and improve margins toward 20–25% as its SaaS business scales. He said growth is driven by media companies moving to cloud-based software and rising use of AI. Amagi, which listed at a discount this week, earns most of its revenue from the US and Europe but sees India as a growth market over the next few years.

articles.title: Hyderabad CEOs unveil top risks hindering India's economic growth
articles.summary: The Mint Leadership Dialogues revealed India's economic risks, including income inequality, supply chain dependence, and regulatory challenges. Leaders emphasized the importance of innovation, investment, and addressing environmental concerns to navigate structural issues and sustain growth.

articles.title: How India’s oil basket altered amid Trump’s pressure—imports from US up 40-50% this fiscal, Russia dips
articles.summary: India’s merchandise exports to US remain positive, despite 50% tariffs, while imports from US grew by 12.85% in the first three quarters of the financial year.

articles.title: India to keep growing 6-8% in real terms in next 5 years: Ashwini Vaishnaw at Davos
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow robustly by 6-8% in real terms over the next five years, according to Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. He highlighted significant improvements in telecom tower installation times, reducing them from 270 days to just 7. Discussions at the World Economic Forum also emphasized the need to boost per-capita income and diversify trade relationships.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Global interest grows in India’s approach to AI, says Vaishnaw
articles.summary: India's focus on making technology accessible and scalable is drawing global attention at the World Economic Forum in Davos. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw highlighted India's approach to using AI and digital platforms for broad-based growth. Global leaders are recognizing India's progress in semiconductors and AI. States are also leveraging Davos for collaborations and attracting investment, showcasing cooperative federalism.

articles.title: Davos WEF 2026: Adani Group sets out Rs 6 lakh cr investment blueprint for India
articles.summary: The Adani Group has unveiled a Rs 6 lakh crore investment plan across aviation, clean energy, and digital infrastructure, focusing on integrated, technology-led platforms. The blueprint, presented at Davos, spans Maharashtra, Assam, and Jharkhand, aiming to boost employment and align with India's growth priorities like energy transition and manufacturing self-reliance.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal meets US Ambassador Sergio Gor, Senator Steve Daines; discusses bilateral issues
articles.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal met with US Ambassador Sergio Gor and Senator Steve Daines to discuss bilateral issues, including ongoing trade agreement negotiations. The discussions come amidst a 50% US import duty on Indian goods and US senators' calls for favorable provisions for American pulse crop producers in any future trade deal.

articles.title: US Senators pitch for favourable pulse crop provision in potential India-US trade pact
articles.summary: In a letter dated January 16, 2026, US Senators Kevin Cramer and Steve Daines have encouraged the US President "to push for favourable pulse crop provisions in any agreement the United States" signs with India as trade negotiations progress.

articles.title: Commerce Ministry: India-US trade talks progressing, no fixed deadline yet
articles.summary: India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement talks are “very near” conclusion, but Commerce Ministry says no deadline can be set. Exports impacted by US tariffs are being managed through diversification and FTAs.

articles.title: How AI is reshaping India’s pharma and healthcare playbook
articles.summary: AI is expected to shift from pilots to scale in Indian pharma by 2026, with BCG noting that early adoption is already accelerating drug discovery and delivering measurable outcomes.

articles.title: 11:11 | Trump's mid-air glitch, threats to wipe out Iran, Snowfall in India, UAE on 'Board of Peace' and more
articles.summary: In today's newsletter we take a look at Trump's journey to Davos that suffered a midair glitch, Trump's threats to wipe out Iran, IMD's snowfall prediction, the Dow Jones's expected yet dramatic fall, the UAE's entry into Trump's Board of Peace, Danish exit from US treasuries and more.

articles.title: WEF 2026: Satellite firm ICEYE and robotics startup Skild AI outline growth plans and funding outlook
articles.summary: At Davos 2026, satellite firm ICEYE and robotics startup Skild AI said rising defence budgets and labour shortages are driving demand for their technologies. ICEYE has signed a €1.4 billion contract with Germany for a new satellite constellation, while Skild AI has raised over $1.4 billion to build software that acts as a “brain” for robots. Both founders said investor interest in deep tech has increased and India could play a role in future robotics manufacturing and supply chains.

articles.title: Republic Day 2026: President sends special invitations to distinguished citizens
articles.summary: Each year, India invites foreign leaders for the Republic Day parade, and their presence gets attention from around the world. This year, President of India has sent invites to Professor M. Krishnan, Dr G Natchiar, and EU leaders Ursula von der Leyen and Antonio Costa for Republic Day 2026 celebrations.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Investments in India's AI infra may cross $150 billion in 2026
articles.summary: India got a commitment of $70 billion investment from Google, Microsoft, and Amazon in the last 12 months. The next 12 months could see nearly as much in fresh commitments, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told CNBC-TV18.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Novartis CEO Vas Narasimhan sees AI payoff for pharma in 7–10 years
articles.summary: Novartis CEO Vas Narasimhan touts AI innovation, cost goals, and neuroscience investment to speed medicine delivery and expand access in India.

articles.title: New labour codes weigh on BFSI sector's earnings
articles.summary: New labour laws in India have increased costs for banks, NBFCs, and insurance firms. Companies adjusted staff benefits to comply with these reforms. HDFC Bank reported an expense impact of about Rs 800 crore. Other lenders like ICICI Bank and Yes Bank also saw significant impacts.

articles.title: A guide to PMAY-Urban 2.0: Affordable housing for urban India
articles.summary: Dream of owning a home? Discover PMAY-Urban 2.0 benefits, including interest subsidies and financial aid for urban housing. Check your eligibility and apply today!

articles.title: JPMorgan's Dimon warns of 'economic disaster' as Trump backs credit card rate cap
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon warned ⁠on Wednesday that a proposal to cap credit card interest rates would amount to economic disaster, while U.S. President Donald Trump doubled down on the idea and said he was asking Congress to approve the move.

articles.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Thursday
articles.summary: Indian markets stayed volatile as global risks, weak banking and IT earnings, and a falling rupee hurt sentiment. Late value buying trimmed losses, while analysts warned volatility may persist, with selective accumulation opportunities emerging amid resilient domestic demand ahead soon.

articles.title: Gainers & Losers: Eternal, Amagi Media among 7 stocks under spotlight on Wednesday
articles.summary: Indian markets fell for the third consecutive session as financials and consumer stocks faced selling pressure. Eternal, MRPL, CreditAccess Grameen, and IndiaMart gained sharply, while Kalyan Jewellers and Tata Communications declined despite strong quarterly earnings.

articles.title: Watch out! Gold, silver on MCX, ETFs trading at premium to international rates
articles.summary: Gold and silver in India are trading at unusually high premiums over global prices as traders price in fears of a customs duty hike in the Union Budget, triggering sharp MCX, ETF gains and arbitrage distortions despite a bullish long-term outlook.

articles.title: Vedanta’s Rs 2,500 crore ESOP windfall turns factory floors into shareholder ranks
articles.summary: Vedanta has created one of India’s widest employee-wealth programmes, generating Rs 2,500 crore in benefits over five years through ultra-low-priced ESOPs. Its latest Rs 500 crore grant brings 1,200 employees—many freshers—into the shareholder fold. With 40% workforce coverage.

articles.title: India bonds gain on growing hopes of RBI support
articles.summary: Indian government bonds drew ‍fresh buying interest on Wednesday, ​with traders adding positions on expectations the Reserve Bank ⁠of India may extend its liquidity support through additional open-market operations and secondary market buying.

articles.title: India’s domestic growth story intact; bullish on mid and smallcaps despite global uncertainty: Dinshaw Irani
articles.summary: Gold’s surge reflects global uncertainty, but India’s domestic fundamentals remain strong, says Helios Mutual Fund CEO Dinshaw Irani. He highlights improving earnings visibility, especially in mid- and small-cap stocks, preference for consumption-led sectors, caution on metals despite rallies, and expects policy support and capex-led growth over the next two years. Domestic consumption, private sector banks, and consumer tech emerge as top picks.

articles.title: ETBudget Boardroom 2026 | Freeze LTCG for 3-5 years to boost certainty, says SBI Mutual Fund’s DP Singh
articles.summary: Markets anticipate Budget 2026 with global uncertainty. DP Singh of SBI Mutual Fund urges a three to five-year freeze on long-term capital gains tax for investor certainty. He also calls for increased offshore investment limits. Singh believes India's domestic market strength and government initiatives will sustain growth momentum. Policy stability is key for long-term capital formation.

articles.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang urges nations to treat AI as core national infrastructure
articles.summary: Speaking to BlackRock CEO Laurence Fink at a World Economic Forum session, Huang emphasised that AI has become as essential to national development as traditional utilities like electricity and transport networks. He stated that the technology represents a fundamental shift in how countries manage their natural resources of language and culture.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,500 amid trade worries and foreign selling
articles.summary: Indian stock markets continued their downward trend on Tuesday, with both the Sensex and Nifty experiencing a second consecutive session of declines. Investors are closely monitoring global trade uncertainties and ongoing foreign fund outflows, while the quarterly earnings season also captures market attention. The Sensex dropped over 300 points, and the Nifty 50 fell more than 90 points.

articles.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are in a wait-and-watch mode, awaiting clarity on tariffs and the Union Budget's capital expenditure focus. CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: 'Mogambo Khush Hua': Kharge likens Trump to iconic villain, questions Modi’s silence
Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: Sensex, Nifty set to react on Donald Trump's 'good deal with India' remark on Thursday
articles.summary: Indian equity markets have sold off sharply over the last few sessions. The Nifty 50 index is down over 1,200 points from the record high level of 26,374 that it rose to earlier this year.

articles.title: India growth story intact despite FII volatility and rupee weakness: Kedaara Capital’s Manish Kejriwal
articles.summary: Amid choppy FII flows and a sharply weaker rupee, Kedaara Capital’s Manish Kejriwal says global investors continue to view India as a resilient, domestic-demand-driven market, even as private equity funds turn more selective on valuations and pace of deployment.

articles.title: State Bank of India Q3 results to be declared on February 7
articles.summary: State Bank of India will announce Q3FY26 results on February 7, 2026, in Mumbai, with an analyst meet at State Bank Bhavan Auditorium. Trading window reopens 48 hours after results.

articles.title: Gravita India Q3 Results: Profit jumps over 25% YoY as margin expands sharply
articles.summary: Gravita India reported a strong Q3FY26 performance, with profit rising 25.3% year-on-year and margins expanding sharply, aided by a surge in EBITDA despite modest revenue growth.

articles.title: TCS eyes AWS, OpenAI as anchor clients for Navi Mumbai data centre: Report
articles.summary: TCS and TPG are developing a Navi Mumbai data centre, targeting AWS and OpenAI as anchor clients. India’s AI infrastructure boom includes AdaniConneX, Google, Meta, Sify, and Reliance projects.

articles.summary: Bank of Baroda on Wednesday announced the signing of a pact with India Infrastructure Finance Company Ltd (IIFCL) to facilitate joint lending and loan syndication for a wide range of infrastructure projects.

articles.title: India's SBI MF to take at least 10% of Adani Group's biggest rupee bond issue, bankers say
articles.summary: State Bank of India's mutual fund unit has committed to pick up at least 10% of Adani Power's nearly $820 million rupee-denominated bond issue, likely to be launched later this week, three merchant bankers said on Wednesday.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Industry leaders pin hopes on retail, green energy, AI, and digital assets
articles.summary: As India prepares for Union Budget 2026, experts across industries are emphasising actionable policies to accelerate growth, boost innovation, and simplify compliance. Key focus areas include unified retail regulations, green energy investments, AI adoption, digital finance, housing affordability, research-led education, and climate resilience—sectors poised to define India’s economic trajectory over the next decade.

articles.title: Nestle India gets relief as Supreme Court dismisses tax appeals involving ₹101 crore
articles.summary: Supreme Court dismisses income tax department’s appeals against Nestlé India over disallowance of general licensing fees for FY1996–98, 1999–2001, and 2004–08. The matter, involving ₹101.21 crore, had earlier been decided in favour of the company by the Delhi High Court. No settlements or impacts on key management; litigation now closed.

articles.title: 436 Under-40 entrepreneurs, $950 billion in business: Inside Hurun’s Uth Series
articles.summary: Avendus Wealth and Hurun India list 436 under-40 entrepreneurs like Nikhil Kamath, Ritesh Agarwal, Ghazal Alagh, shaping India’s economy with a net worth over $950 billion.

articles.title: Bank of India Q3 Results: Net profit up 8% on higher NII and better asset quality
articles.summary: Bank of India reported a 7.5% year-on-year rise in Q3 net profit to ₹2,705 crore, supported by a 6.5% increase in net interest income to ₹6,462.6 crore, while asset quality improved sequentially with gross NPA declining to 2.26% and net NPA easing to 0.60%.

articles.title: Maharashtra Municipal poll results: Is it game over for Shiv Sena (UBT) and NCP (SP)?
articles.summary: While the results of the closely watched elections to 29 municipal bodies in Maharashtra underscored the strength of the ruling Mahayuti, attention now turns to the future of the Uddhav Thackeray–led Shiv Sena, the NCP factions, and the Congress-led Maha Vikas Aghadi, writes political analyst and writer K V Prasad.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Industry leaders push for policy boosts in health, tech, mobility, and compliance
articles.summary: Industry leaders urge Union Budget 2026 to boost mental health, AI, electric mobility, supply chains, hospitality, education, and MSME compliance for India’s next phase of innovation and growth.

articles.summary: India’s ongoing economic reforms are being widely recognised both domestically and internationally, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in a recent interview

articles.summary: The suspension of the trade deal will heighten tensions between the US and the EU, after Trump announces fresh, incremental tariffs on eight European nations over the Greenland issue.

articles.summary: We do not expect major income tax cuts or big changes in GST in this budget, as the government remains focused on controlling the fiscal deficit, says Atul Parakh, CEO of Bigul.

articles.summary: Blackstone Inc. is considering an initial public offering for Indian glass packaging maker PGP Glass Pvt. in Mumbai that could raise as much as $500 million, according to people familiar with the matter.

articles.summary: Tata Group stocks, including Tata Chemicals and Trent, hit one-year lows amid a deepening sell-off in the Indian stock market, driven by global trade tensions and investor caution. Tata Chemicals dropped 4.2% to ₹700, while Trent fell nearly 4% to ₹3,736.

articles.title: OnePlus to shut down? Report claims company is being ‘dismantled’, CEO breaks silence
articles.summary: OnePlus India CEO Robin Liu has refuted shutdown rumours after a viral report claimed that the brand was being dismantled. Liu said operations remain ‘as usual’ and urged stakeholders to trust official sources. nbsp;

articles.summary: The European Parliament has referred the EU-Mercosur free trade agreement to the bloc's top court, casting legal uncertainty over the recently signed pact. This move, celebrated by some farming groups, follows concerns about agricultural imports and environmental standards.

articles.title: Budget expectations 2026: Recycling industry seeks open scrap trade; flags tariff risks to circular economy
articles.summary: Recycling industry leaders urged policymakers to prioritize open markets and ease cross-border scrap movement in the Union Budget 2026, deeming it critical for a resilient circular economy. Global market access for recycled materials is seen as the biggest enabler for investment and sustainability amidst rising protectionism.

articles.title: Regulatory clarity key for crypto adoption: Binance co-CEO Richard Teng
articles.summary: Binance co-CEO Richard Teng says clearer crypto regulations are needed for wider adoption in India, even as the US leads the sector. He views crypto as complementary to UPI and sees AI and blockchain as mutually reinforcing technologies. Teng also explained why enthusiasm around central bank digital currencies is dying globally.

articles.title: India may give a $1 billion relief to footwear industry to cushion against 50% Trump tariffs: Report
articles.summary: India is preparing a significant financial package to bolster its footwear industry. This initiative aims to strengthen the entire production chain, from raw materials to finished goods. The move comes as the sector faces challenges from US tariffs and seeks to enhance domestic production and exports.

articles.title: US-based voice AI startup Cartesia to launch operations in India: CEO Karan Goel
articles.summary: San Francisco-based startup Cartesia, which builds real-time voice AI agents, is launching operations in Bengaluru with a $2.5 million investment. The India office will hire researchers and support clients, helping build solutions for Indian business needs. Cartesia’s platform powers enterprises and startups with low-latency, scalable voice AI infrastructure.

articles.title: Budget 2026 may not offer big stimulus, focus likely on governance reforms: Kotak’s Pratik Gupta
articles.summary: Kotak Institutional Equities CEO Pratik Gupta said global bond yields, US policy uncertainty and continued FII selling are key risks for Indian markets. He said the IPO pipeline remains strong despite lower valuations and limited foreign interest. Gupta expects low fiscal stimulus in Budget 2026, with focus on reforms and steps to support the rupee and capital inflows. He advised investors to stay cautious, noting large caps are near fair value while mid and small caps may see further downside.

articles.summary: The Gates Foundation and OpenAI are setting up a $50 million partnership to help several African countries use artificial intelligence to improve their health systems and mitigate the impact ‌of international aid cuts, ‌Bill Gates said on Wednesday.

articles.title: ‘Australia is a gift’: Indian-origin investor’s post after India visit sparks online debate, draws mixed reactions
articles.summary: An Indian-origin investor's glowing praise for Australia as a "gift" has ignited a fiery online debate. Bhavdip Sanghvi lauded Australia's safety, freedom, and opportunities, urging citizens to appreciate its benefits. While some agreed, others criticized his remarks for potentially demeaning India and dismissing legitimate Australian concerns about housing and cost of living.

articles.title: World Economic Forum: Why exactly was Canada’s former PM Justin Trudeau in Davos?
articles.summary: Former Prime Minister Justin Trudeau addressed the World Economic Forum in Davos, explaining the end of an era of global stability. He highlighted the rise of "hard power" among great nations and advocated for "soft power" through diplomacy, trade, and mutual support, illustrating his point with a story about Canadian solidarity during a perceived alcohol shortage.

articles.title: Pension boost: Cabinet extends Atal Pension Yojana till FY31; funding support to continue for outreach & gap needs
articles.summary: The Union Cabinet has approved the continuation of the Atal Pension Yojana until FY 2030-31. This decision includes extended government funding for promotional and developmental activities. The move aims to strengthen old-age income security for unorganised sector workers.

articles.title: ‘Portray India terribly’: Canadian woman slams content creators for selective coverage
articles.summary: In a spirited viral video, a Canadian woman shines a light on the rich tapestry of India's beauty, urging international content creators to shift their focus from cliched narratives of poverty. She showcases the splendor of opulent resorts and the breathtaking variety of landscapes, drawing a stark contrast to the distorted portrayals that emphasize festivals and flights, ultimately perpetuating racism.

articles.title: Hospitals, insurers rejig operations as DPDP kicks in next year
articles.summary: India’s healthcare and health insurance sectors are ramping up data protection as the DPDP Act comes into force in May 2027. Hospitals and insurers are embedding privacy into operations, updating policies, and investing in compliance tools. The legislation is seen as both a regulatory mandate and an opportunity to build long-term trust in the space.

articles.title: Tariffs be damned: Global CEOs are still betting on India
articles.summary: Global CEOs see India as a top investment spot for 2026. Strong economic growth, a large consumer base, and stable policies are key attractions. India's economy is expanding rapidly, outpacing many nations. Reforms in taxation and labor laws further boost confidence. This makes India a resilient and attractive destination for international capital amid global slowdowns.

articles.title: Govt to pump ₹5,000 cr into SIDBI to step up credit for MSMEs
articles.summary: The Union Cabinet has approved a Rs 5,000 crore equity infusion into SIDBI to boost credit for MSMEs. This capital, released over three years, aims to increase financial assistance recipients from 76.26 lakh to 1.02 crore by 2028, potentially creating over a crore new jobs.

articles.title: Atal Pension Yojana gets Cabinet nod for extension upto 2031, ensures monthly pension for informal sector
articles.summary: The Union Cabinet has approved the continuation of the Atal Pension Yojana (APY) until 2030-31, ensuring assured monthly pensions for millions of low-income and unorganised sector workers. This extension includes continued government funding for outreach and gap funding, guaranteeing pensions of ₹1,000 to ₹5,000 per month from age 60 for those without formal retirement benefits.

articles.title: Budget 2026: The next phase of India’s growth depends on resolving a critical imbalance
articles.summary: India Budget 2026 Expectations: As Budget 2026 approaches, urban India's middle class is holding back on discretionary spending, impacting economic value chains. While rural demand has recovered, urban consumption remains fragile due to persistent inflation in essentials and EMI burdens. Policy measures focusing on tax relief and reducing system friction are crucial to revive urban spending without compromising fiscal discipline.

articles.title: Budget 2026: FinMin shares status of key direct tax reforms for investors, startups and aam aadmi
articles.summary: India's government has finalized key direct tax reforms to boost investment and simplify compliance. Measures include clarified taxation for Alternative Investment Funds, extended startup tax holidays, and incentives for electronics manufacturing. Individual savers benefit from enhanced National Savings Scheme and NPS Vatsalya provisions, alongside property tax relief.

articles.title: Heavy IPO supply may cap market upside in 2026; returns likely to stay moderate: Ashish Gupta, Axis MF
articles.summary: Indian stock markets face challenges for big gains in 2026. A large supply of new shares from IPOs and promoter sales will keep valuations in check. While domestic investment remains strong, this increased supply is balancing demand. Investors should expect a more selective market, focusing on specific sectors like financials and automobiles.

articles.title: 61% of crypto investors favour stock or mutual fund-like taxation, 17% back standalone regime: CoinSwitch survey
articles.summary: A CoinSwitch survey ahead of the Union Budget shows most Indian crypto investors want taxation aligned with stocks or mutual funds. While 61% favour equity-like tax treatment and 17% prefer a separate framework, 66% view the current regime as unfair, highlighting the need for rationalisation and clearer regulations.

articles.title: From bloodbath to bounce: Sensex erases 1,000 point shock, Nifty above 25,250 as bargain hunters step in
articles.summary: Indian equities staged a sharp midday rebound after erasing nearly Rs 6 lakh crore in market value earlier in the session, with the Sensex and Nifty clawing back into positive territory. Bargain buying in heavyweight stocks drove the pullback, though analysts warned the recovery appeared more reflexive than a sustained turnaround.

Early backers and founders of Amagi Media Labs saw a modest dip in paper gains following the listing.

articles.title: As Eternal names a new CEO, a look back at Zomato’s journey
articles.summary: Eternal — the parent company of Zomato and Blinkit — announced in a stock exchange filing on Wednesday that its founder Deepinder Goyal has resigned from his position as CEO. The company has named Blinkit founder and CEO Albinder Dhindsa Goyal’s successor, effective February 1.

articles.title: Intel results to spotlight turnaround efforts as AI data centers boost chip demand
articles.summary: Intel shareholders are optimistic about the company's results like they have not been for many quarters, betting the turnaround CEO ‍Lip-Bu Tan promised was taking root and that ​rapid data center build outs were fueling strong demand for its traditional server chips.

articles.title: Meta's new AI team delivered first key models internally this month, CTO says
articles.summary: At a press briefing on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum's ‌annual meeting ‌in Davos, CTO Andrew Bosworth said the models built by its Meta Superintelligence Labs team, formed last year, showed a ‌lot of promise.

articles.title: This is a change in title, not in commitment: Deepinder Goyal on stepping down as Eternal CEO
articles.summary: In a letter to shareholders, Goyal said this decision comes from his desire to pursue "significantly higher-risk exploration and experimentation" that falls outside the strategic scope of a listed entity.

articles.title: What next for Deepinder Goyal? A look at his ventures beyond the Eternal universe
articles.summary: Outside the Eternal universe, which consists of food delivery platform Zomato, quick commerce app Blinkit, going-out business District, and business-to-business supplies firm Hyperpure, Goyal has founded and invested in other sectors.

articles.title: ET@Davos: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis on China's AI Leap & Limitations, the AGI Myth & More
Deepinder Goyal steps down as Eternal CEO: Read his full letter to shareholders
articles.summary: Deepinder Goyal announced on Wednesday that he is stepping down as the group CEO of Eternal, transitioning to the role of vice chairman on the board of directors, subject to shareholder approval. Albinder Dhindsa, CEO of Blinkit, has been named the new group CEO.

articles.title: Deepinder Goyal resigns as Eternal CEO; company names Albinder Dhindsa as successor
articles.summary: The company has named Blinkit founder and CEO Albinder Dhindsa as Goyal's successor, effective February 1. Goyal will step into the vice-chairman role and will remain on Eternal’s board of directors. "Of late, I have found myself drawn to a set of new ideas that involve significantly higher risk exploration and experimentation. These are the kinds of ideas that are better pursued outside a public company like Eternal," Goyal said in a letter to shareholders.

articles.title: Pine Labs unit Setu receives RBI nod to acquire account aggregator Agya Technologies
articles.summary: With this nod, Setu can raise its stake to 100 in Agya Technologies, which till now operated as an associate company of Setu. The acquisition, expected to be completed soon, comes at a time when regulated data-sharing infrastructure is becoming central to lending, credit underwriting, and the distribution of financial services.

articles.title: India among most important markets for us, will continue to invest there: Cisco
articles.summary: Speaking to PTI here during the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting, the company's President and Chief Product Officer said India accounts for the largest concentration of its people outside the US.

articles.title: AI most profound platform shift in human history; every job, workflow will be reconfigured: Cisco
articles.summary: Speaking to PTI here during the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting, the technology giant's President and Chief Product Officer, Jeetu Patel, said every job will get reconfigured, and every workflow is going to change due to AI.

articles.title: India FTA to create market of 2 billion people: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen
articles.summary: The European Union is on the brink of a landmark trade agreement with India, potentially linking a consumer base of two billion individuals. In a bid to strengthen these negotiations, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen is scheduled to visit India shortly. This strategic move reflects the EU's goal of broadening its global trade horizons and fostering international collaboration.

articles.title: “Mother of all trade deals” with India coming soon: EU’s Ursula von der Leyen at WEF
India-Europe ‘mother of all deals’ within reach as EU chief Ursula von der Leyen hints at breakthrough
articles.summary: In a move that could redefine trade relationships, India and the European Union are finalising a groundbreaking free trade agreement. EU dignitaries Ursula von der Leyen and Charles Michel are set to be the esteemed Chief Guests at India's Republic Day celebration.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Date and time of historic Sunday presentation by Nirmala Sitharaman
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026 date time: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget 2026–27 on February 1 at 11 am, her ninth budget in Parliament. As the presentation falls on a Sunday, BSE and NSE will keep equity markets open, with pre-open trade from 9 am to 9:08 am and normal trading from 9:15 am to 3:30 pm.

articles.title: India's billion-dollar trade deal may be the real show this Republic Day
articles.summary: India and the European Union are set to announce the conclusion of negotiations for a long-pending free trade agreement at a summit in New Delhi on January 27, coinciding with India’s 77th Republic Day celebrations. The deal, described by Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal as the “mother of all trade deals,” caps nearly two decades of stop-start talks and is expected to be signed in the coming months after legal clearances.

articles.title: Budget 2026 and why stability, not scale, matters in today’s fractured global order
articles.summary: India's democratic institutions offer a rare competitive edge in a volatile global economy. As geopolitical risks reshape trade, regulatory certainty and predictable processes are paramount for attracting investment. Reforms in customs, export controls, and stakeholder consultation are crucial for building a trustworthy, rules-based economic ecosystem, shielding currency risks from becoming investment hesitations.

articles.title: US-EU bitter trade row may boost India exports, sweeten Europe FTA
articles.summary: A potential US-EU trade dispute could boost Indian exports as the EU seeks stronger ties with nations like India. With the US imposing tariffs on several European goods, the EU may expedite its free trade agreement talks with India. This could lead to a more favorable deal and faster ratification, presenting India as a stable trade partner amidst global uncertainties.

articles.title: India, EU set to conclude FTA talks on January 27; deal after legal clearances
articles.summary: India and the European Union will announce the conclusion of free trade agreement negotiations at a summit on January 27. A security and defence partnership agreement will also be signed. EU leadership will attend India's Republic Day celebrations as chief guests. Negotiations for the trade pact resumed in 2022 and are in the final stages.

articles.title: China urges WTO to set up panel in case against India's incentive schemes for auto, battery, EV
articles.summary: China has requested the WTO's dispute settlement body to establish a panel to examine its case against India's incentive schemes for auto, battery, and electric vehicles. Bilateral consultations failed to resolve the dispute, with China alleging the schemes violate global trade rules by discriminating against its goods.

articles.title: India-EU Summit: Trade, defence and mobility deals on table
articles.summary: European Council President Antonio Costa and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will be the chief guests at the Republic Day celebrations on January 26, and the India-EU summit will be held the next day.

articles.title: India-UAE aim to double trade to $200 billion by 2032; ink deals on LNG, defence, and space
articles.summary: India and the UAE have set an ambitious target to double bilateral trade to $200 billion by 2032, signing key agreements in energy, defense, and space. A 10-year LNG supply deal between HPCL and ADNOC was confirmed, bolstering India's energy security. The nations also advanced defense and space cooperation, signaling a decade of closer economic and strategic integration.

articles.title: Goodbye VCRs, hello OTT: India’s inflation basket prepares for a reset
articles.summary: India's inflation gauge is undergoing a significant overhaul, phasing out outdated items like VCRs and introducing modern essentials such as smartphones and streaming services. While free food from the public distribution system will be excluded to align with global norms and prevent inflation distortion, this decision sparks debate among economists about a complete inflation picture.

articles.title: IMF raises India's FY26 growth forecast to 7.3%
articles.summary: India's economic growth is projected to be robust. The International Monetary Fund has increased its forecast for India's FY26 growth to 7.3 percent. This makes India the fastest-growing economy among major nations. The World Bank also revised its outlook upwards. Global growth is expected to be steady. Inflation in India is anticipated to return to target levels.

articles.title: Wall Street seeks to shape Trump affordability ideas, sources say
articles.summary: Major Wall Street banks are ​pushing back on some of President Donald Trump's ideas for lowering the U.S. cost of living ahead of ⁠mid-term elections, while suggesting others in an effort to shape policy, sources familiar with the discussions said.

articles.title: Homebuyers' body FPCE seeks interest subsidy on home loans to boost demand for affordable housing
articles.summary: Homebuyers' body FPCE has demanded that the government in the upcoming Budget provide interest subsidy on home loans to people purchasing affordable and mid-income housing.

articles.title: Nearly 3,800 acres land deals in 2025 for housing, commercial, data centre projects: Anarock
articles.summary: Real estate consultant Anarock on Wednesday said that at least 126 land deals totalling 3,772 acres were closed last year for the development of housing, commercial, mixed-use, warehousing and data centre projects.

articles.title: RBL Bank bulk deal: BNP Paribas sells 60 lakh shares worth Rs 178 crore; BofA picks up stake
articles.summary: BNP Paribas sold 60 lakh RBL Bank shares via a bulk deal, reducing its stake, while BofA Securities bought in. The transaction came amid recent stock weakness, despite strong one-year returns, improved asset quality, and robust profit growth.

articles.title: ET Market Watch: 3-day rout wipes out Rs 14 lakh crore as global risks and FII selling weigh on markets
Market Trading Guide: Buy Dalmia Bharat and CreditAccess Grameen on Thursday for up to 12% upside
articles.summary: Nifty extended its decline for a third session, slipping below the 200-DMA intraday amid selling in financials and consumer stocks. Analysts warn of near-term volatility, highlighting key support and resistance levels and recommending Dalmia Bharat and CreditAccess Grameen.

articles.title: Sebi's rap on the knuckles: Investment adviser pulled up for routing client money through employee account
articles.summary: SEBI reprimanded Ankur Jain of Winway Research for multiple regulatory breaches, including routing client funds through employee accounts, charging overlapping fees, failing to maintain call records, and not resolving SCORES complaints, rejecting his defense explanations.

articles.title: MakeMyTrip Q3 adjusted net profit up 14% at $51.4 million
articles.summary: Nasdaq-listed online travel service provider, MakeMyTrip Ltd on Wednesday reported a 14.47 per cent rise in adjusted net profit to USD 51.4 million in the third quarter ended December 2025.

articles.title: Jindal Stainless Q3 Results: Profit grows 26% to Rs 828 crore
articles.summary: Jindal Stainless on Wednesday posted 26 per cent year-on-year growth in consolidated net profit to Rs 828 crore in December quarter FY26, driven by increased sales.

articles.title: HPCL Q3 Results: Cons PAT soars 58% YoY to Rs 4,011 crore, revenue up 5%
articles.summary: HPCL reported a sharp rise in Q3 profit on stronger refining margins, higher crude throughput and steady fuel sales growth. Revenue also increased sequentially, supported by record refinery utilisation and network expansion across retail outlets and LPG distribution.

articles.title: Dhanlaxmi Bank Q3 profit rises 20% YoY to Rs 24 crore
articles.summary: Dhanlaxmi Bank posted a 20% YoY rise in Q3 net profit to Rs 24 crore despite higher provisions. Total income grew 21%, while pre-provision operating profit jumped 52% to Rs 41 crore. Asset quality improved with gross NPAs falling to 2.36%. Shares closed 1.7% lower at Rs 24.50.

articles.title: IndiGo Q3 Preview: Revenue growth steady, profits seen under pressure as yields soften
articles.summary: IndiGo is expected to report a mixed set of numbers for the December quarter, with brokerages pencilling in steady revenue growth but a year-on-year decline in profitability as yields soften and cost pressures remain elevated.

articles.title: Eternal Q3 Results: 10 key takeaways from earnings, competition to business outlook
articles.summary: Eternal posted robust Q3 results, led by Zomato’s accelerating food delivery growth and Blinkit and Hyperpure turning EBITDA positive, even as profitability and revenue surged. The quarter also marked a leadership change, with Deepinder Goyal stepping aside for Albinder Dhindsa.

articles.title: Raymond Realty aims Rs 5,000 cr revenue from new luxury housing project in Mumbai
articles.summary: Raymond Realty on Wednesday said it will develop a new 5.62-acre luxury housing project in Mumbai with an estimated revenue of around Rs 5,000 crore.

articles.title: Insurance firms boost stakes in 12 largecap stocks in Q3FY26
articles.summary: Insurance companies raised their stakes in 12 NSE largecap stocks during the December 2025 quarter, signalling growing confidence in select equities. The increase in holdings, tracked via StocksEdge data, reflects insurers’ strategic allocation towards fundamentally strong companies amid evolving market conditions.

articles.title: Eternal Q3 Results: Cons profit zooms 73% YoY to Rs 102 crore, revenue soars 201%; Deepinder Goyal steps down as CEO
articles.summary: Eternal Q3 Results: Eternal, operator of Zomato and Blinkit, announced a significant 73% profit jump to Rs 102 crore and a 201% revenue increase to Rs 16,315 crore. Deepinder Goyal is transitioning from MD CEO to Vice Chairman. Albinder Singh Dhindsa will now lead the company as CEO. The food delivery segment saw strong growth and record margins.

articles.title: 'Commodity is new currency': Kotak Securities' Anindya Banerjee on how to invest in gold & silver in 2026
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices are rising due to global monetary changes and trade tensions. Experts suggest it is not too late to invest. Gold could reach ₹1,60,000-₹1,65,000 and silver ₹3,65,000-₹3,70,000. Investors can use a mix of lump-sum and SIP investments. Crude oil prices may see temporary spikes due to geopolitical risks.

articles.title: Rekha Jhunjhunwala ups promoter stake by 1,253 bps to 15.57% in Star Health in December quarter
articles.summary: Rekha Jhunjhunwala increased her promoter stake in Star Health to 15.57% in the December quarter amid persistent stock underperformance. The move comes as the insurer reported weaker profitability and continued to trade below key moving averages.

articles.title: WEF Davos: CFI, Bharti show interest in setting up data centres in Karnataka
articles.summary: Global companies are eyeing Karnataka for significant investments. CFI Technologies and Bharti Enterprises plan new data centres. Carlsberg Group confirms a Rs 350-crore bottling unit. Bharat Forge explores manufacturing opportunities. Mistral AI intends to build a Global Capability Centre. Philip Morris International seeks to manufacture smoke-free products. Imperial College London considers an R D centre.

articles.title: D2C brand Kapiva launches Rs 50 crore fund to support R&D in Ayurveda
articles.summary: Healthcare brand Kapiva launched a Rs 50 crore innovation fund to support research and product development in Ayurveda. The fund will back projects from academia, startups, and labs, with grants ranging from Rs 50 lakh to Rs 6 crore. Kapiva will also provide mentoring, infrastructure, and expand its Bengaluru R D facilities to aid applicants.

articles.title: Energy startup Enerzolve raises $5.1 million led by Jungle Ventures, Kae Capital
articles.summary: Deeptech energy startup Enerzolve Smart Technologies raised $5.1 million in a funding round led by Jungle Ventures and Kae Capital, with several angel investors participating. The company plans to use the capital to deepen its core intellectual property across silicon, firmware, and power electronics, expand engineering and product teams, and set up pilot manufacturing and certification for key product lines.

articles.title: Deepinder Goyal looks beyond Eternal
articles.summary: Deepinder Goyal is stepping down as CEO of Eternal, which he cofounded 18 years ago. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Solar platform Aerem raises $15 million from Sumitomo Mitsui’s venture arm, others
articles.summary: Aerem Solutions has raised $15 million (Rs 136 crore) in a round led by the SMBC Asia Rising Fund, the venture capital (VC) arm of Japan’s Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation. Existing investors including British International Investment (BII), UTEC, Blume Ventures, Avaana Capital, Riverwalk Holdings, and SE Ventures also participated in the round.

articles.title: No refund if you cancel late. Railways tighten rules for Vande Bharat, Amrit Bharat trains: Check new norms here
articles.summary: New ticket cancellation rules are now in effect for Vande Bharat Sleeper and Amrit Bharat II trains. Passengers cancelling confirmed tickets less than eight hours before departure will receive no refund. This change aims to reduce last-minute cancellations and improve berth utilization. These premium trains operate on a 100% confirmed berth policy, unlike regular trains.

articles.title: Union agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan addresses media on VB-G Ram G Act | LIVE
Blackstone finalises structured investment deal in AI cloud startup Neysa
articles.summary: US firm Blackstone has finalised a structured investment in Mumbai-based AI cloud startup Neysa, initially putting in $50–75 million. The deal allows Blackstone to increase its stake to a controlling position if certain business milestones are met. Neysa was was last valued at $120-130 million, and has raised $50 million in funding across two rounds till now.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the Mightiest - How understanding fiscal policy & government spending will help you make money in the stock market
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. By now we have a fair idea how the RBI, with its control over interest rates and money supply, acts as a crucial hand on the economic tiller. There is, however, another hand at work, one that operates more directly: Fiscal policy. And this is the domain of the government. And it is expressed through the Union Budget, slated for February 1. Understanding the budget is thus crucial. In this series, Macro the

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the mightiest - Part 8: How to read the yield curve, and use it to gain an edge in the markets
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. Now, investors are constantly searching for a reliable crystal ball that accurately predicts the future. While no indicator is perfect, one has come closer than any other: The yield curve. A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
articles.summary: Had it not been for the hit taken by the ITC stock, the Nifty and Sensex would have ended much higher on the first trading day of 2026. Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: Wall Street bounces back after Donald Trump says he won’t use force to take Greenland
articles.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average was up 477 points, or 1%, as of 11 a.m. Eastern time, and the Nasdaq composite was 1.3% higher. Treasury yields also eased in the bond market, a day after jumping, in a potential signal of worries about higher inflation in the long term.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Deal conversion key to unlocking AI revenue: Wipro's Rishad Premji
articles.summary: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji highlights AI scaling as the key challenge, with deal conversion delays impacting growth, but expects revenue upside as order bookings rise and AI platforms expand.

articles.title: Delhi Police to deploy AI-enabled smart glasses with facial recognition for Republic Day security
articles.summary: For the first time, the Delhi Police will deploy AIenabled smart glasses equipped with an integrated facial recognition system (FRS) and thermal imaging technology as part of enhanced security measures for Republic Day celebrations, an official said on Wednesday.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Wipro's AI-led turnaround faces bumps despite strong deal wins—Rishad Premji explains why
articles.summary: Rishad Premji says order bookings and large deals offer comfort, but client ramp-up delays and cost pressures continue to weigh on near-term growth.

articles.title: EU freezes US trade deal vote after Trump’s Greenland threats: Report
articles.summary: The European Parliament suspended the EU–US trade pact after Donald Trump threatened tariffs unless Denmark sells Greenland, deepening tensions and raising doubts about US reliability.

articles.title: Waaree Energies Q3: Net profit, revenue, margins post healthy sequential growth
articles.summary: Waaree Energies Q3 net profit rose 26% to ₹1,062 crore, revenue up 24.7% over the previous quarter. Shares of Waaree Energies ended lower on Wednesday, January 21, by 2.82% at 2,435.70.

articles.title: PNB Housing Finance Q3 Results: Net profit up 11% on strong retail disbursements, stable asset quality
articles.summary: PNB Housing Finance reported a 10.6% year-on-year increase in Q3 net profit to ₹521 crore, supported by a 12.8% rise in net interest income to ₹757 crore. Growth was driven by steady expansion in the retail loan book, which rose 16% year-on-year to ₹81,931 crore and now accounts for nearly the entire loan portfolio, while the corporate book continued to shrink sharply.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Donald Trump pushes fossil fuels, nuclear power and slams green energy
articles.summary: Trump said domestic energy policy under the previous administration had weakened America’s position.

articles.title: Anant Raj Q3 Results: Profit rises 31% on-year, margin expands
articles.summary: Anant Raj reported a strong Q3FY26 performance, with net profit rising 30.7% year-on-year, supported by healthy revenue growth and improved operating margins.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Trump's tariffs aren't crashing global growth—Gita Gopinath explains why
articles.summary: Gita Gopinath explains why the real economic impact of US tariffs has been far smaller than feared, as AI-led investment, strong equity markets and expansionary fiscal policy across major economies continue to support growth despite rising trade uncertainty.

articles.title: Stocks to Watch for Jan 22: Dr Reddy's, HPCL, Eternal, Waaree Energies and more
articles.summary: Eternal Ltd, Jindal Stainless, Dr Reddy’s Laboratories, HPCL, and others report strong Q3 results; CESC Green Power signs MoU for a major UP solar project. Here are few stocks to track ahead of Thursday's trading session.

articles.title: Lemon Tree Hotels signs new 85-room property in Madhya Pradesh
articles.summary: Lemon Tree Hotels Limited signed a licence for Lemon Tree Premier, Omkareshwar in Madhya Pradesh, expanding its presence with 85 rooms near the sacred Narmada River and Jyotirlinga.

articles.title: ‘What I’m asking for is a piece of ice’: Trump rules out force to get Greenland
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump said Greenland is vital to international security and cannot be defended by any country other than the United States, while insisting he would not use force as he renewed calls for acquisition talks.

articles.title: MakeMyTrip posts double-digit growth in Q3 as hotels, packages drive demand
articles.summary: MakeMyTrip reported a strong Q3 FY26 with double-digit growth in bookings and margins, driven by hotels, packages and ancillaries, offsetting slower domestic air travel demand.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Trump hails ‘economic miracle’, says US growth outpacing global forecasts
articles.summary: Donald Trump told Davos the US economy is booming under his policies, claiming inflation is beaten, investment is surging and America is powering global growth.

articles.title: Trade Setup for January 22: Nifty manages to defend 25,000 but recovery lacks conviction
articles.summary: The Nifty Bank was one index that had capped the Nifty downside for a better part of the last two weeks. However, after hitting the 60,000 mark last week, the index has also collapsed, taking the Nifty down with it.

articles.title: ICICI Prudential Smallcap Fund reopens for subscriptions from January 23, 2026
articles.summary: ICICI Prudential Smallcap Fund will reopen for subscriptions from January 23, 2026, with all PAN-level investment restrictions withdrawn, allowing lump sum, switch-ins, SIP, and STP transactions, while all other scheme provisions remain unchanged.

articles.title: KEI Industries Q3: Profit jumps 43%, margins expand; interim dividend declared
articles.summary: KEI Industries posted 42.5% profit growth at ₹234.8 crore in Q3FY26, driven by its core cables and wires segment. Board declared ₹4.50 interim dividend and approved delisting from Calcutta Stock Exchange.

articles.title: This founder is set to become CEO of the company that acquired his startup
articles.summary: Albinder Dhindsa, Founder of Grofers and CEO of Blinkit, is set to become Group CEO of Eternal Ltd, succeeding Deepinder Goyal, after leading Blinkit to rapid growth and profitability.

articles.title: Mad kings of diplomacy: From Trump to Nixon, leaders who turned unpredictability into foreign policy
articles.summary: From Richard Nixon to Donald Trump, six global leaders used unpredictability as diplomacy. The Madman Theory explains how fear and ambiguity became strategy, reshaping negotiations, alliances and global security.

articles.title: 'Daddy's Little Helper': California governor awards Trump 'Peace Prize'
articles.summary: Newsom accompanied the post with an AI-generated image of himself with a 'babyfied' version of Trump and encouraged followers to "congratulate Daddy's Little Helper".

articles.title: Govt approves equity support of ₹5,000 cr to SIDBI
articles.summary: The government approved ₹5,000 crore equity support for SIDBI, aiming to boost MSME credit, add 25.74 lakh new beneficiaries, and generate 1.12 crore jobs by 2027-28.

articles.title: CESC's green arm to invest ₹3,800 crore in Uttar Pradesh solar plant
articles.summary: CESC Green Power Ltd signed an MoU with the Uttar Pradesh government to set up a 3GW solar cell and module plant, a 60 MW solar power plant, R D facilities, and ancillary units, at an investment of around ₹3,800 crore; this comes on the heels of a ₹4,500-cr project in Odisha.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Automation is a secular growth story; Honeywell bets on Forge and physical AI to drive productivity
articles.summary: Honeywell sees long-term growth in industrial automation as companies seek higher efficiency across energy, supply chains and buildings, with its Forge platform and sector-specific use of AI expected to support steady revenue and earnings expansion even as the company moves towards a three-way corporate split by 2026.

articles.title: HPCL Q3 Results: Net profit up by 6%; misses Street estimates
articles.summary: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd posted Q3 FY26 net profit of ₹4,072.5 crore, missing estimates. Revenue rose to ₹1.15 lakh crore. Visakh and Mumbai refineries operated near full capacity.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | JPMorgan’s Filippo Gori sees positive global mood, strong India flows and robust M&A pipeline
articles.summary: Geopolitics, inflation and AI expected to shape investment decisions in 2026, says

articles.title: What it would take for India to be a high-income country by 2047
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has set a goal for India to become a developed nation by 2047. Based on recent trends and estimates, here’s a snapshot of the growth rate required to achieve that goal.

articles.title: Global growth to hold steady at 3.3% in 2026, says IMF; India seen growing at 6.4% in FY27
articles.summary: India’s growth outlook remains one of the strongest, with expansion projected at 6.4% in both FY27 and FY28, after an upward revision to 7.3% for FY26 on the back of a stronger-than-expected outturn. India's growth projections are 6.3% for 2026 and 6.5% for 2027 based on calendar year, the IMF said in its report.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Jewellers' body recommends GST rationalisation and MSME support
articles.summary: The GJC has submitted pre-Budget recommendations to the Centre, seeking GST rationalisation, MSME relief and measures to boost formalisation.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Theme, who is attending, India's presence and more — All you need to know
articles.summary: The World Economic Forum is claiming record levels of government participation, with 400 top political leaders expected to take part, alongside nearly 850 of the world's top CEOs. The top political leaders include 65 heads of state and government and six of the G7's leaders.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Experts pinpoint key growth opportunities across sectors
articles.summary: From wellness-led healthcare and defence indigenisation to execution-driven infrastructure spending and climate-focused incentives, experts believe Budget 2026 has the potential to unlock multi-year growth across key sectors if policy support is aligned with implementation and capital efficiency.

articles.title: India urges start-ups to focus more on manufacturing, continue work on deep-tech
articles.summary: PM Narendra Modi urged Indian startups to pivot towards manufacturing, deep-tech and space, citing expanded procurement, funding support and policies to position India as a global technology leader.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal: India-EU FTA will be the ‘mother of all deals’; No EU member opposes
articles.summary: India and European Union may finalise a Free Trade Agreement by 27th January, with support from all 27 EU states. Talks cover CBAM, GI, critical minerals, and aim for balanced trade growth.

articles.title: India, EU target conclusion of FTA talks within two weeks: Commerce Ministry
articles.summary: India and the European Union are in the final leg of Free Trade Agreement talks, with 20 of 24 chapters closed and negotiations underway daily in virtual mode.

articles.title: Dr Reddy’s Q3 Results: Profit beats estimates on higher revenue, despite YoY decline
articles.summary: Dr Reddy’s Laboratories reported Q3 net profit of ₹1,209 crore, beating estimates, while revenue and EBITDA also came in above expectations; though on a year-on-year basis, profit and EBITDA declined and margins contracted sharply, a 4.4% rise in revenue notwithstanding.

articles.title: Fintech firm ZET receives NPCI approval to launch UPI payments on RuPay credit cards
articles.summary: ZET gains NPCI approval as TPAP, launches ZET UPI for RuPay credit card-linked UPI payments, powered by Juspay and RBL Bank, offering cashback and credit-building for first-time borrowers.

articles.title: Why Deepinder Goyal left Eternal CEO role to work on extending human lifespan, aircraft startup
articles.summary: Deepinder Goyal has stepped aside as Group CEO at Eternal to focus on high-risk ventures spanning longevity research, brain-health wearables and hybrid-electric aircraft, pursued outside the listed company.

articles.title: Deepinder Goyal steps down as Eternal CEO; Blinkit chief Albinder Dhindsa to take over
articles.summary: Eternal founder Deepinder Goyal has stepped down as Group CEO, with Blinkit head Albinder Dhindsa set to take charge, subject to shareholder approval, as Goyal continues on the board as Vice Chairman.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Welspun group is expanding in energy sector with $500 million investment, says BK Goenka
articles.summary: Overall, the multinational conglomerate Welspun Group is expanding in the energy sector with an investment of over $500 million, with $100 million investment in Saudi Arabia and $400 million in the US. Read on:

articles.title: Davos 2026 | GST cuts, cricket sponsorship drive tyre demand in India; Europe remains a tightrope for Apollo Tyres
articles.summary: Apollo Tyres is leaning on strong domestic demand, improved consumer spending and brand-led rural expansion to drive growth in India in 2026, even as weak volumes, rising Chinese competition and margin pressures keep its European business in a tight spot, prompting cost cuts and manufacturing realignment.

articles.title: ReNew’s Sumant Sinha explains why 2026 could be a breakout year for India’s renewable energy sector
articles.summary: India’s rapid rise as a global solar powerhouse, combined with accelerating electrification and new growth areas such as green hydrogen and data centres, could mark a turning point for the country’s clean energy ambitions. ReNew Chairman and CEO Sumant Sinha says these structural shifts may position India as a major renewable energy hub as early as 2026, even as global energy markets remain fragmented by geopolitics.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Saint-Gobain to accelerate capex, acquisitions in India; positions country as key export hub
articles.summary: Saint-Gobain plans to significantly scale up investments and acquisitions in India while transforming the country into a regional export hub for building materials, as strong infrastructure demand and manufacturing capabilities make India central to the group’s global growth strategy.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Industrial automation at a turning point as AI, sustainability and India converge: Schneider Electric CEO
articles.summary: As companies push beyond pilot projects, Schneider Electric says India’s water, steel and infrastructure sectors are emerging as key beneficiaries of AI-led industrial automation, with sustainability, electrification and cost efficiency increasingly driving investment decisions.

articles.title: Vardhman Textiles Q3: Profit slides 21% on margin squeeze despite steady revenues
articles.summary: Vardhman Textiles Limited saw Q3FY26 net profit drop 21.3% to ₹166 crore, EBITDA fall 9.4%, while revenue rose 1.6% to ₹2,505 crore. Shares fell 1.70% post results.

articles.title: Jindal Stainless Q3 Results: Profit up 27% YoY, margin improves; dividend declared
articles.summary: Jindal Stainless reported a strong Q3 performance with profit rising 26.6% year-on-year and margins expanding, while the board approved an interim dividend and reappointed three independent directors.

articles.title: Raymond moves beyond South Mumbai—Wadala is its next big bet
articles.summary: Raymond Realty launches The Address by GS, Wadala, a 5.62-acre premium project in central Mumbai with ₹5,000 crore potential, expanding beyond South Mumbai and boosting connectivity and amenities.

articles.title: Newgen Software shares buck the trend after a 15% sell-off; Jefferies sees 'attractive' risk-reward
articles.summary: At 22 times its estimated price-to-earnings ratio for financial year 2027, on normalised growth expectations, Jefferies said the risk-reward looks attractive for Newgen Software.

articles.title: Nifty slips below key levels, analysts see deeper downside risk
articles.summary: Gautam Baid, Equity Advisor at Complete Circle Stellar Wealth PMS, said the market correction is creating opportunities for selective investors. He noted early signs of earnings resilience in segments such as microfinance-focused lenders, gold financiers, silver-related plays and parts of the auto ancillary space, despite the broader market weakness.

articles.title: Tata Communications Q3 Results: Stock falls 6% after margins narrow, other income aids profit
articles.summary: Tata Communications profitability was aided by a higher other income component during the quarter, which was up nearly 10x from the same period last year.

articles.title: Nifty earnings growth may pick up to 12-13% in FY27: Pankaj Tibrewal
articles.summary: Pankaj Tibrewal, Founder and CIO of IKIGAI Asset Manager, said several sectors are turning attractive after recent corrections. He sees opportunities in private sector banks, pharma stocks including CDMO and domestic players, auto and auto ancillaries, as well as select capital goods companies with strong order visibility and more reasonable valuations.

articles.title: Low Budget hopes could actually help markets: Sunil Singhania
articles.summary: Abakkus Asset Manager founder Sunil Singhania said recent market declines and a surge in stocks hitting 52-week lows are creating selective buying opportunities. He advised investors to focus on earnings visibility and valuations rather than market size, and said his firm has increased investments in recent days. Singhania said financials and pharma remain preferred sectors, while expectations from the upcoming Union Budget are low, reducing the risk of market disappointment.

articles.title: Eternal's quick commerce turns profitable as Goyal exits, Dhindsa steps in
articles.summary: Eternal's shares are down significantly from their 52-week high and all eyes will be on the company's outlook for the quick commerce business as well as food delivery.

articles.title: Gold and silver soar in India: How to invest amid all-time highs
articles.summary: Gold hit ₹1.54 lakh per 10 gm and silver ₹3.25 lakh per kg in India, driven by global tensions, US dollar weakness, and investor demand, with analysts urging cautious investment strategies.

articles.title: Kalyan Jewellers shares end 12% lower, extend losses for the eighth day in a row
articles.summary: Promoters of Kalyan Jewellers had acquired a 2.36% stake from Warburg Pincus in August 2024 at ₹535 per share. The stock is trading well below those levels. The amount of pledged shares from promoters has also increased to 24.89% at the end of the December 2025 from 19.32% in December last year.

articles.title: MNS offers support to Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena in Kalyan Dombivli civic body
articles.summary: Shiv Sena MP Shrikant Shinde on Wednesday made the claim about the MNS offering support to his party. However, local MNS leaders could not be contacted despite attempts.

articles.title: At 45, Nitin Nabin set to become BJP’s youngest president
articles.summary: BJP confirms Nabin is the only candidate in the fray; formal announcement expected on Tuesday morning, (January 20) in an event where PM Modi is expected to be present.

articles.title: WEF 2026: UP secures ₹9,750 crore MoUs at Davos for clean energy, AI and defence projects
articles.summary: The UP government signed MoUs worth ₹9,750 crore at the WEF Annual Meeting 2026 as part of its push to position the state as a future-ready investment destination. The series of MoUs outlines a growing investment pipeline in clean energy, digital infrastructure, artificial intelligence and defence manufacturing.

articles.title: Sabarimala gold loss case: Kerala court grants bail to prime accused Unnikrishnan Potty
articles.summary: Unnikrishnan Potty gets bail in the Sreekovil gold loss case at Sabarimala but remains jailed for the Dwarapalaka idols case; SIT has arrested 12 including two former TDB presidents.

articles.title: Sudha Murthy warns public about AI-generated deepfake videos promising unrealistic investment returns
articles.summary: Sudha Murthy stated that she never discusses investments and that the statements made in these fake videos are false.

articles.title: Draft NEP 2026 Unveiled: Govt bets on clean power, market reforms and grid overhaul
articles.summary: The Draft National Electricity Policy (NEP) 2026 targets per capita electricity consumption of 2,000 kilowatt hours (kWh) by 2030, up from 1,460 kWh in 2024–25, and more than 4,000 kWh by 2047.

articles.title: Republic Day Long Weekend: Last-minute getaways from Delhi, Mumbai, and other major cities
articles.summary: The Republic Day long weekend is a good chance to take a short break without using many leave days. For those who have not planned ahead, there are still several destinations close to major cities that are easy to reach and do not need detailed planning. Here are some last-minute travel ideas from major Indian cities that can be covered comfortably in two or three days.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Tariffs, risky geopolitics have not stopped CEOs from investing: PwC
articles.summary: PwC’s latest CEO survey shows that global business leaders are staying invested despite rising tariff risks and geopolitical uncertainty. Speaking to CNBC-TV18 from Davos 2026, PwC Global Chairman Mohamed Kande and PwC India Chairperson Sanjeev Krishan explain why capital continues to flow despite the risks.

articles.title: WEF 2026: Andhra Pradesh to announce new investments over next 90 days, says Nara Lokesh
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh IT minister Nara Lokesh said Andhra Pradesh is focusing on building full industrial ecosystems, combining land, skilled workforce, testing facilities and certification infrastructure. He said the state already accounts for about 50% of India’s air-conditioner manufacturing and expects this to rise to 70% after recent deals.

articles.title: Nitin Nabin is new BJP national president, PM Modi calls him 'boss'

articles.summary: Negotiators have struck a balance on sensitive areas with agriculture and dairy sectors respecting both sides’ red lines, while the EU has agreed to provide greater market access for Indian labour-intensive exports.

articles.summary: Jatin Dalal, Chief Financial Officer of Cognizant, said the company is preparing for its next phase of growth by doubling down on artificial intelligence, outcome-based contracts and selective mergers and acquisitions.

articles.title: Eternal's Blinkit and Hyperpure turn EBITDA positive in Q3
articles.summary: Quick commerce leader Blinkit posted a historic Rs 4 crore EBITDA profit in Q3 as revenues jumped to Rs 12,256 crore driven by supply chain savings and festive buying.

articles.title: WEF Davos: Karnataka holds talks with Bharti, PayPal, Mistral AI on expansion
articles.summary: From data centres to AI hubs, Karnataka pitched investment opportunities to international firms at WEF Davos. Deputy CM Shivakumar positioned Bengaluru as the "city of the future."

articles.summary: The government said following the equity infusion that the number of MSMEs receiving financial assistance from SIDBI is expected to rise from 7.62 million at the end of FY25 to about 10.2 million by FY28, or about 2.57 million new beneficiaries.

articles.title: Mint Explainer: What RBI’s unified foreign exchange rules mean for India’s service exporters
