articles.title: SBI Research says India to be world’s third largest economy by 2028, upper middle-class income country by 2030 — Details
articles.summary: India is projected to become an upper-middle income country by 2030 and the third largest economy by 2028, according to an SBI Research report. Here's a look at the projections, how achievable they are, and the likely challenges. nbsp;

articles.title: Decades-long reforms: How India's discoms returned to profits but have  ₹7 trn of cumulative debt to deal with
articles.summary: India's power distribution sector returned to profit in FY25, reporting ₹2,701 crore net profit after years of losses. The overhang of a cumulative debt over ₹7 trillion still remains, but reforms and improved operational indicators contributed to this revival.

articles.title: Economic activity pickup to help India record all time high toll collection of Rs1 trillion in FY27
articles.summary: While Icra analysts suggest the ₹1 trillion mark is more likely in the ‘medium term’, government officials expect the operationalization of 12,000 km of new highways and the MLFF system to fast-track this milestone.

articles.title: Trump's 10% tariff threats over Greenland could unleash a ‘trade bazooka’ as EU leaders mull action
articles.summary: With Trump threatening tariffs on eight EU countries over his mission to acquire Greenland, leaders of the nations called an emergency meeting on Sunday, mulling countermeasures.

articles.title: One year of Trump 2.0: The twists and turns that impacted India and Indians
articles.summary: Since returning to office in January 2025, Donald Trump has used many tools from tariffs, to tighter borders, and military interventions. Many of which has hit India significantly.

articles.title: Build-operate-transfer model returns: India to bid out half its highways, worth Rs75,000cr, next fiscal
articles.summary: Armed with an investor-friendly concession agreement, the Centre plans to bid out half of the national highway projects in fiscal 2027. This will total 5,000 km worth ₹75,000 crore under the build-operate-transfer (BoT) toll model—a bidding structure that was popular 10-20 years ago.

articles.title: Indian industry confidence hits five-quarter high on demand, reform optimism: CII survey
articles.summary: Business confidence rose for a third straight quarter in October–December, lifted by resilient domestic demand, reform expectations and capex optimism, even as global uncertainty weighs on growth.

articles.title: India’s unemployment rate stable in December, but remains stubbornly high in urban areas
articles.summary: While the rural unemployment rate remained static at 3.9% during December, the urban unemployment rate edged up slightly to 6.7% from 6.5% in November, underscoring the persistent strain on these labour markets, the survey showed.

articles.title: India’s trade gap widens in December as imports surge, exports stay resilient
articles.summary: The goods trade deficit rose to $25.04 billion in December, up from $24.53 billion in the previous month and $20.63 billion in December 2024, according to provisional data.

articles.title: Income tax rules due soon, FY27 Budget to see minimal tax law changes
articles.summary: While the Finance Bill may bring minimal changes, new rules under the Income Tax Act, 2025, could reshape taxpayer rights, compliance, and safeguards.

articles.title: Asaduddin Owaisi says those who faced defeat in Maharashtra civic polls should introspect
articles.summary: Owaisi says the AIMIM is now preparing for upcoming municipal elections in Telangana, noting that the leadership has already invited names from potential candidates

articles.title: Tata Communications Q3 Results: Net profit jumps 55% YoY to  ₹364 crore, revenue rises 7%
articles.summary: Tata Communications financial results for the December quarter show a consolidated net profit of ₹364.28 crore, a 55% year-on-year increase. Revenue from operations grew to ₹6,189 crore, with Data Services leading growth despite a decline in Voice Solutions revenue.

articles.title: Aritas Vinyl allotment to be finalised today: Step-by-step guide to check your allotment status
articles.summary: Aritas Vinyl IPO allotment is set for today, January 21. The ₹37.52 crore IPO was oversubscribed 2.21 times, with retail investors oversubscribing 2.88 times. Refunds begin January 22 for those not allotted shares, which will be credited the same day. Listing on BSE SME is expected January 23.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Big bang reforms unlikely; infra push, structural measures to get focus amid global headwinds: PL Capital
articles.summary: Budget 2026: Big bang announcements are unlikely in the upcoming Budget 2026-2027, following last year’s sweeping tax reforms. Instead, the government is expected to focus on sustaining growth through incremental reforms and targeted capital expenditure, expects PL Capital.

articles.title: Why AU Small Finance Bank's profit surge isn't just about growth
articles.summary: Lower provisions, improved asset quality, and a rebound in unsecured lending drove AU Small Finance Bank’s Q3 profit growth. But rising operating costs and a competitive deposit market could cap upside going forward.

articles.title: Sebi, Amfi in talks on cutting KYC, depository charges with an eye on mutual fund profitability
articles.summary: The discussions come a month after Sebi cut brokerage and transaction costs for mutual funds and tightened the overall total expense ratio (TER) framework.

articles.title: Markets are looking shaky. How to ride out another trade war.
articles.summary: Renewed tariff fears have led to a selloff in bonds and most stocks. Gold and silver, energy and small-caps are faring better.

articles.title: KRM Ayurveda IPO Day 1: Latest GMP, subscription status, listing date & other details about  ₹77.5 crore issue
articles.summary: KRM Ayurveda IPO, opened on January 21, saw a subscription of 0.66 times by 01:30 PM. The price band is set between ₹128-135, aiming to raise ₹77.5 crore. The allotment date is January 27, with shares listing on NSE SME scheduled for January 22.

articles.title: Small-cap pharma stock rebounds from today's low after this API update worth  ₹250 crore
articles.summary: Sigachi Industries shares rebounded after announcing progress on a new combination of APIs for Cystic Fibrosis, projecting revenue of ₹250 cr annually by FY2026-27. The move enhances growth potential in a market expected to exceed USD 10 bln, focusing on innovative treatments for rare diseases.

articles.title: A storm blew through the bond market. What could keep the sell-off going.
articles.summary: There is potential for more volatility in the Treasury market.

articles.title: Simplified GST registration leaves MSMEs trapped if turnover rises
articles.summary: The GST portal blocks small businesses whenever their output tax exceeds the ₹2.5 lakh threshold. They can't even register as a regular business without three GST returns.

articles.title: How can I allocate my investments to ensure my retirement savings don't run out?
articles.summary: Investing the entire corpus in a fixed deposit might not work out in the long run, so a more nuanced approach and diversified approach is required.

articles.title: Sharpe ratio and what it means for your risk-adjusted returns

articles.title: How to get insured if you have a pre-existing health condition

articles.title: Why rebalancing and SIPs matter more than perfect entry points
articles.summary: India’s markets may be booming, but disciplined asset allocation and regular rebalancing—not market timing—are what help investors compound wealth, manage volatility and avoid costly behavioural mistakes.

articles.summary: Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google DeepMind, predicts artificial general intelligence will transform science and health within a decade, ushering in an era of abundance. He notes China's progress in AI capabilities but highlights its current lack of frontier innovations. Hassabis also discusses AI's impact on jobs and energy, emphasizing potential benefits and new opportunities.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Markets shrug off geopolitics as AI, data centres and power grids fuel a new growth cycle: Blackstone CEO
articles.summary: Stephen Schwarzman says global investors are prioritising artificial intelligence-led growth and infrastructure spending over unresolved geopolitical risks, as massive investments in data centres and power grids reshape economic momentum in the US and beyond.

articles.title: Top Stories | Davos 2026, Trump threatens tariffs on France, BCCI-Gemini deal, Rupee's new low and more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm

articles.title: AI will transform the global economy, but job growth remains a key risk: Eswar Prasad at Davos
articles.summary: Eswar Prasad, Professor of Economics at Cornell University and former head of the IMF’s China division, said breaking out of the doom loop will be difficult as the challenges are structural. He noted that progress will require engaged citizens focused on shared prosperity, strong leadership that looks beyond short-term interests, and the rebuilding of credible national and international institutions.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Power, security, and enterprise readiness to define next phase of AI adoption in 2026, say tech CEOs
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence shifts from experimentation to large-scale deployment, technology leaders at Davos warn that energy constraints, cyber security risks, and the need for enterprise-grade decision systems will determine how fast and how safely AI can be adopted in 2026.

articles.title: Road map in works for $100 billion textile and apparel exports by 2030
articles.summary: India plans to significantly boost textile exports to $100 billion by 2030. The strategy involves increasing shipments to Free Trade Agreement partners and focusing on premium products like handlooms and silk. New districts will be developed to join the export ecosystem. This initiative aims to expand India's global market share in textiles.

articles.title: Trump effect: Cotton fabrics exports drop 30%
articles.summary: Indian cotton textile exports saw a sharp fall after the US introduced tariffs in August 2025. Shipments dropped by nearly 30 percent following the levy. This decline impacted all categories, including fabrics, made-ups, and ready-made garments. Companies are exploring strategies like discounts to mitigate the impact. The situation is expected to remain volatile for some time.

articles.title: Economists flag AI stock froth, warn of crypto slide and weaker dollar: WEF report
articles.summary: Chief economists are divided on AI-driven equity valuations, warn of downside risks for cryptocurrencies, see mixed prospects for gold, and expect the US dollar to weaken, a WEF survey shows.

articles.title: JPMorgan UK unit to open branch in Gujarat's GIFT City
articles.summary: JPMorgan had set up a unit in Gift City in 2024 to develop derivative products, while the US bank’s Indian unit opened a branch in the hub in 2022. The latest move will allow JPMorgan to trade financial instruments for clients based outside India.

articles.title: Exclusive | ReNew revives US delisting plan; CEO Sumant Sinha flags challenges of staying listed
articles.summary: ReNew Energy Global may delist from NASDAQ as CPPIB and ADIA revive the take-private plan, aiming for an India listing; Masdar exited the consortium, impacting the earlier deal.

articles.title: AM Group signs MoU with Uttar Pradesh at Davos for AI hub, $25 billion investment by 2030
articles.summary: AM Group signed a MoU with the Uttar Pradesh government at Davos to invest about USD 25 billion and build a 1-GW AI compute hub in Greater Noida, with first capacity in 2028 and full rollout by 2030.

articles.title: Republic Day 2026: Centre plans Vande Mataram theme as EU leaders visit India for parade and trade talks
articles.summary: The Centre plans a Vande Mataram theme for Republic Day as EU leaders visit India, with a parade, cultural events and an EU-India summit scheduled next day.

articles.title: OpenAI to test targeted ads in ChatGPT, stepping up revenue push
articles.summary: The ads will appear in the coming weeks for logged-in users of the free version of ChatGPT as well as a newer, lower-cost $8-a-month “Go” plan that first launched in India and is now expanding to the US, the company said Friday. The more expensive paid tiers of ChatGPT will remain free of ads.

articles.title: 'Zero appeals received': CEC Gyanesh Kumar hails 'successful' SIR at IICDEM 2026
West Bengal SIR: EC orders publication of names under 'logical discrepancies' and 'unmapped' categories
Eyeing net zero future, Niti Aayog releases roadmaps for decarbonisation of aluminium, cement, MSME sectors
Delhi govt to increase its sewage treatment capacity to 1,500 MGD by 2028: CM Gupta
articles.summary: Delhi aims to boost its sewage treatment capacity to 1,500 MGD by 2028 to clean the Yamuna River. The government will complete drone surveys of drains by January and connect all unauthorized colonies to the sewerage network by 2028. Coordination with Haryana and Uttar Pradesh is deemed essential for the river's cleanup.

articles.title: 'Wants to make his jail barracks better': Wife Gitanjali Angmo on Sonam Wangchuk; activist seeks thermometer, book
'Because colour of my flag is green': AIMIM corporator Sahar Shaikh clarifies her 'paint Mumbra green' remark
Evening news wrap: Trump lands in Switzerland ahead of Davos address; IAF aircraft makes 'forced landing' in UP, and more
Issue over speech? Karnataka Governor refuses to address joint session; Siddaramaiah government reaches out
articles.summary: Karnataka governor Thaawarchand Gehlot has refused to deliver the customary address to the legislature, adding to a recent trend of gubernatorial disputes. This follows similar incidents in Kerala and Tamil Nadu, where governors clashed with state governments over speech content and assembly proceedings. The Karnataka government is set to meet the governor to understand his reasons.

articles.title: 'Enriching progress of India': PM Modi greets Manipur, Meghalaya and Tripura on Statehood day; states formed in 1972
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended warm greetings to Manipur, Meghalaya, and Tripura on their Statehood Days, celebrating their rich cultures, scenic beauty, and developmental contributions. He lauded Manipur's passion for sports and nature, Meghalaya's vibrant culture, and Tripura's blend of tradition and progress, wishing them continued growth and prosperity.

articles.title: US markets today: Wall Street steadies after sharp sell-off, Trump rules out force over Greenland
articles.summary: US stocks steadied after a sharp decline, as investors assessed easing US-Europe tensions over Greenland. While equities saw modest gains, gold prices surged, signaling ongoing risk aversion amid trade uncertainties. Corporate news included Netflix's subscriber slowdown and Kraft Heinz's potential stake sale.

articles.title: From ‘dead’ economy to ‘hottest’: Trump pitches US as economic engine of the world at WEF; ‘most dramatic turnaround…’
Investing in a child’s name: How mutual fund accounts for minors work, rules to know, and tax impact explained
articles.summary: Parents can invest in mutual funds for minors, with the child as the sole holder, managed by a guardian. Upon turning 18, control fully transfers to the child. While beneficial for disciplined long-term savings, parents lose control post-majority. Tax implications differ before and after the child becomes an adult.

articles.title: Eternal leadership: Who is Albinder Dhindsa? Set to replace Zomato co-founder Deepinder Goyal
'Drawn to new ideas': Deepinder Goyal resigns as CEO of Zomato parent company Eternal
articles.summary: Zomato's parent company Eternal Limited CEO Deepinder Goyal is stepping down from his role, subject to shareholder approval, to pursue high-risk, experimental ideas outside the public company. He will transition to Vice Chairman on the board, with Albinder Dhindsa named as his successor.

articles.title: Budget 2026 real estate expectations: Affordability, tax rationalisation & more; here's what the sector wants
articles.summary: The real estate sector is anticipating Budget 2026 to bring policy continuity, targeted fiscal measures, and long-pending reforms. Industry leaders are seeking measures to address housing affordability, boost urban growth, improve capital access, and expedite regulatory approvals to sustain market confidence and long-term investment.

articles.title: 'Smug and arrogant’: Trudeau’s reaction to Covid vaccine question sparks online backlash - watch
articles.summary: Former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's reaction to a journalist's question about COVID-19 vaccine deaths has gone viral. When asked if a cameraman's mother dying after vaccine complications was misinformation, Trudeau laughed, called it "disinformation," and walked away, sparking widespread criticism online.

articles.title: Screen Reader iconScreen Reader
Philippines to restore access to Grok after developer commits to safety fixes
articles.summary: The move ⁠to block came as governments and regulators from Europe to Asia cracked down on sexually explicit content generated by Grok on the social media platform X, launching probes, imposing bans and demanding safeguards.

articles.title: OpenAI rolls out age prediction on ChatGPT
articles.summary: OpenAI's ‌CEO of applications, Fidji Simo, had in December said that she expects "adult mode" to debut within ChatGPT in the first quarter of 2026, following chief executive Sam Altman's comments about allowing mature content for users ‍who verify their age.

articles.title: Tier-II GCC dream awaits govt bridge to cross execution gap
articles.summary: Despite budget promise, government has not formalised national framework; global firms stay cautious over talent depth and fragmented rules.

articles.title: PhonePe gets Sebi nod for IPO; Microsoft, Walmart to pare stake in OFS
articles.summary: Walmart-backed PhonePe has secured Sebi approval for its IPO, clearing a major hurdle for one of India’s biggest fintech listings. The $14.5-billion startup plans a $1.5-billion OFS, with Walmart, Tiger Global, and Microsoft set to sell shares. Strong payments dominance and rising revenues underpin investor confidence.

articles.title: Lodha Developers to invest $11 billion in 2.5 GW data centre park in Maharashtra
articles.summary: ​India's Lodha ⁠Developers said on Tuesday ‌that it ‌would ‌invest an additional Rs 1 lakh crore ($11 billion) ​to ​build a ‌2.5 ‍gigawatt data ‍centre park in the ‌state of Maharashtra, expanding on an ‍earlier commitment of Rs 30,000 ‍crore.

articles.title: Ecommerce platforms may post 20-22% growth in Republic Day sales
articles.summary: Ecommerce marketplaces such as Amazon India and Flipkart are set to post 20–22% growth during their ongoing Republic Day sales compared with last year, extending the online shopping momentum seen during the 2025 festive season, according to industry experts.

articles.title: India must speed up AI upskilling: Coursera cofounder Andrew Ng
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is redrawing the skills map for India’s $280 billion IT services industry, and unless professionals upskill at speed, job disruption could be severe, said AI pioneer Andrew Ng, founder of DeepLearning.AI and cofounder of Coursera. He also cautioned against the swelling hype over AGI, arguing that large language models are not a path to human-level intelligence and that claims of AGI being imminent are misleading.

articles.title: WEF 2026: MP govt holds talks with Tech Mahindra president on expanding IT, BPO in tier-II cities
articles.summary: The Government of Madhya Pradesh on Monday interacted with Harshul Asnani, president of Tech Mahindra, to look at entering the state of Madhya Pradesh with a focus on expanding in tier-II cities to deepen access to talent.

articles.title: India fertiliser imports on track to hit all-time high of $18 billion this fiscal year
articles.summary: India's fertilizer imports are set for a record surge this fiscal year. Officials predict a 76% jump to $18 billion. This increase is fueled by farmers expanding crop areas after heavy rains. Consumption of key fertilizers like urea and DAP is rising significantly. This trend reflects ample monsoon rainfall encouraging winter crop planting across the nation.

articles.title: Budget 2026–27: Government plans double-digit hike in rural scheme allocations to boost growth, demand
articles.summary: The government is planning double-digit increases in allocations for key rural schemes in Budget 2026–27 to boost growth and demand, with higher spending likely on rural jobs, housing and roads.

articles.title: Tax structure for MNCs with India biz may be reworked
articles.summary: India is considering revamping its permanent establishment tax framework, including formula-based profit attribution, to protect taxing rights, offer clarity to MNCs and digital firms, and reduce long-running tax disputes.

articles.title: NITI Aayog reports on government's women safety schemes should be public: CIC
articles.summary: The Central Information Commission has directed that NITI Aayog's evaluation reports on women safety schemes must be publicly accessible. These independent assessments evaluate scheme implementation and effectiveness. In a related directive, the Ministry of Women and Child Development is advised to proactively disclose contract details on its website.

articles.title: Reduce customs duty slabs in Budget 2026: GTRI
articles.summary: India's customs duty structure needs simplification. The Global Trade Research Initiative suggests reducing the actual number of duty slabs, not just basic customs duty rates. This reform aims to boost ease of doing business. Current complexities hinder manufacturing and exports. Simplifying tariffs and processes is crucial for economic growth and competitiveness.

articles.title: India’s core sectors' growth accelerates to 4-month high of 3.7% in December
articles.summary: India's eight core infrastructure sectors grew by 3.7% in December 2025, a slowdown from the previous year but an acceleration from November's 2.1% expansion. This growth, driven by coal, fertilisers, steel, cement, and electricity, signals a positive trend for industrial momentum as these sectors hold significant weight in the Index of Industrial Production.

articles.title: Govt to extend quality certification fee concessions for small firms by 3 years
articles.summary: Quality certification fee concessions for small and medium enterprises will be extended by three years. This move supports India's manufacturing sector. The Bureau of Indian Standards is facilitating this extension. Micro units will receive an 80 percent fee reduction. Small enterprises get a 50 percent reduction. Medium-sized firms will benefit from a 20 percent concession.

articles.title: India's sugar output jumps 22% to 15.9 million tonnes by mid January: ISMA
articles.summary: India's sugar production has seen a significant jump of 22 percent by mid-January in the 2025-26 season. Higher cane supplies and improved yields are supporting this growth. Mills are operating at a higher capacity. However, falling sugar prices are impacting mill finances and farmer payments.

articles.title: FICCI's Manufacturing Index reaches all-time high in Q3 FY26
articles.summary: India's manufacturing sector shows sustained growth and optimism, with 91% reporting higher or same production levels in Q3 FY 2025-26. Domestic demand is also strong, with 86% anticipating increased orders. Despite capacity utilization near 75%, global and operational challenges are noted, though export expectations remain positive.

articles.title: India ranks 16 among 154 countries on Responsible Nations Index
articles.summary: India secured 16th place out of 154 countries in the new Responsible Nations Index, a framework assessing national conduct towards citizens, the environment, and the world. The index, launched by the World Intellectual Foundation, highlights that economic strength doesn't guarantee responsible behavior, with developing nations often outperforming wealthier ones in key areas.

articles.title: India's December oilmeal exports fall 40% on weak soyabean meal shipments
articles.summary: In December, India's oilmeal exports plummeted by 40 percent, largely attributed to a drastic decline in soyabean meal shipments. Other oilmeals, such as rapeseed and castorseed meals, also saw diminished export levels. Conversely, the exports of rice bran extraction experienced a remarkable upswing. Over the April-December timeframe, total oilmeal exports faced a 6 percent drop.

articles.title: US construction spending rebounds in October amid renovations
articles.summary: U.S. construction spending increased more than expected in October, likely reflecting ‍home renovations, with activity elsewhere ​weak.

articles.title: Tata Communications Q3 Results: Cons PAT jumps 55% YoY to Rs 365 crore, revenue up 7%
articles.summary: Tata Communications posted strong Q3FY26 results with profit up 55% year on year and revenues rising 7%. Sequential profits doubled, data revenues grew 9.3%, margins improved, and management highlighted data-led growth momentum and a robust order book for future expansion.

articles.title: ET@Davos: Binance co-CEO on the Importance of Crypto Regulation & More
European shares extend selloff on trade jitters
articles.summary: European shares dipped on Wednesday, deepening a selloff sparked by renewed trade tensions linked ‌to Greenland, ‌which overpowered the impact of upbeat corporate updates.

articles.title: RBI active in buy-sell USD/INR FX swaps across maturities, traders say
articles.summary: ‍India's central ​bank conducted buy-sell ⁠USD/INR foreign-exchange swaps across multiple maturities on Wednesday, ‌traders ‌said, in a ‌move seen aimed at managing liquidity.

articles.title: Eternal shares soar 6% ahead of Q3 results today. Here’s what to expect
articles.summary: Eternal's stock saw a significant jump today. The company is set to announce its third quarter results. Strong growth is anticipated, boosted by Blinkit's new model and quick commerce. Analysts expect revenue to surge. However, focus will be on Blinkit's losses and overall margin trends. Food delivery growth is steady. Blinkit's expansion continues, but profitability remains a concern.

articles.title: Netflix shares drop 7% in Europe after Q4 results
articles.summary: Netflix ‍shares listed ​in Frankfurt fell ⁠in early trade on Wednesday despite beating expectations ‌for ‌fourth quarter revenue and earnings, ‌as the company remains locked in a fierce bidding war for Warner ​Bros Discovery.

articles.title: Metals mid-cycle, FMCG a sell-on-rallies; platform firms are new consumption play: Dipan Mehta
articles.summary: Market veteran Dipan Mehta flags caution on metals at mid-cycle levels, calls FMCG a sell-on-rallies trade, and names quick-commerce platforms as India’s new consumption play. He highlights selective opportunities in IT services, commercial vehicles and specialty chemicals, urging investors to stay invested, buy on corrections, and focus on long-term structural growth over short-term momentum across market cycles ahead in India.

articles.title: OpenAI seeks to increase global AI use in everyday life
articles.summary: The initiative - called OpenAI for Countries - will expand the reach of its products and help close the gap between countries with broad access to AI technology and nations that do not ‌yet have ‌the capacity, the company said.

articles.title: Founders, investors see paper gains shrink as Amagi lists at 12% discount
articles.summary: Among investors, Norwest Venture Partners, which holds a 11.3% stake in the company post-IPO, is sitting on a 1.8x paper gain on its investment, compared with an estimated 2.1x gain at the time the price band was announced. The investment firm sold 33.8 lakh shares for Rs 122 crore through the offer-for-sale component of the IPO.

articles.title: Google, Anthropic say no plans to advertise on chatbots yet, diverging from OpenAI's plan
articles.summary: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis said during an interview in Davos that Google has "no plans" to introduce ads into its Gemini chatbot. Commenting on OpenAI’s move to monetise its free and low tiers, Hassabis said, “It’s interesting they have gone for that so early. Maybe they feel they need to make more revenue.”

articles.title: Rapido FY25 revenue jumps 44% to Rs 934 crore, loss narrows 30% to Rs 258 crore
articles.summary: Bengaluru-based Rapido's net loss for FY25 came in at Rs 258 crore, down 30% from the year ended March 2024. This was mainly on a marked improvement in operating leverage, with its Ebitda losses (or operating losses) coming down to Rs 104 crore against Rs 409 crore in FY24.

articles.title: OpenAI to unveil chatbot ads to its advertisers: Report
articles.summary: OpenAI is asking that to a small pool of advertisers for less than $1 ‌million in ‌spending commitments each over a several week trial period, with ‌ads launching in early February, the report said.

articles.title: Amagi Media Labs shares list at 12% discount to IPO price on BSE, NSE
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs made a weak market debut, listing at a 12% discount despite strong subscription demand. The Rs 1,789 crore IPO comprised a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 816 crore and an offer for sale of Rs 972.62 crore. The IPO was open for subscription between January 13 and January 16, with allotment finalised on January 19.

articles.title: Wipro CEO sees growing demand for IT services from AI
articles.summary: As budget constraints loosen, Wipro is bidding for several small AI deals alongside large- and ‌mega-deals, Pallia said on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum's annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland, without providing details. "We'll go after both (small and large deals) because different clients, different industries, and different markets are at different maturity stages," he told ​the Reuters Global Markets Forum.

articles.title: Brazil gives Musk's xAI 30 days to tackle fake sexualised content from Grok
articles.summary: The Brazilian ‌consumer protection agency Senacon, data protection authority ANPD and the Office of Federal Prosecutors said they can take further administrative or judicial measures if X does not ​comply.

articles.title: Voice AI startup Bolna raises $6.3 million from General Catalyst, others
articles.summary: Voice AI startup Bolna has raised $6.3 million in a funding round led by Silicon Valley-based venture capital firm General Catalyst. The round also saw participation from Y Combinator, Blume Ventures, Orange Collective, Pioneer Fund, Transpose Capital, and Eight Capital, along with angel investors.

articles.title: Persistent Systems Q3 profit jumps 17.8% YoY, beats estimates despite labour code hit
articles.summary: Mid-tier IT services company Persistent Systems has reported a 17.8% year-on-year increase in December-quarter net profit, despite taking a one-time charge due to labour code changes, surpassing analyst estimates

articles.title: AI-native deals, services strengthening IT spends: LTIMindtree CEO Venu Lambu
articles.summary: LTIMindtree is seeing rising demand for AI-led and AI-native services, even as discretionary enterprise spending remains uncertain. The company reported 6.1% year-on-year growth and is targeting double-digit growth by Q4. In a bid to expand its domain capabilities and geographical presence, the company is looking for acquisition opportunities, chief executive Venu Lambu said.

articles.title: Fabless startup Sensesemi raises Rs 25 crore to build edge-AI chips
articles.summary: Bengaluru-based fabless semiconductor startup Sensesecmi Technologies has raised Rs 25 crore (about $2.75 million) in a seed round led by Piper Serica, with participation from LetsVenture Angel Fund, Sun Icon Ventures, MyAsiaVC, White Pine Investments, and Jain Oncor.

articles.title: Cookware startup Cumin Co bags $5 million led by Fireside Ventures
articles.summary: Gurugram-based kitchenware brand Cumin Co. has raised $5 million in a pre-series A round led by Fireside Ventures, with participation from Atrium Angels, Mokobara founders Sangeet Agrawal and Navin Parwal, and Tracxn founder Abhishek Goyal.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Honeywell doubles down on automation, data and physical AI, says CEO
articles.summary: Honeywell is reshaping its strategy around automation, data and physical AI, with CEO Vimal Kapur highlighting productivity gains, cautious capital allocation and limited tariff impact at Davos 2026.

articles.title: Bihar govt awards ₹100-crore Aadhar enrolment centres project to BLS
articles.summary: The Bihar government on Tuesday awarded a project worth Rs 100 crore to an AI and techenabled company for establishing Permanent Enrollment Centres (PEC) for Aadhaar, a company official said.

articles.title: Japan bond market liquidity weakens as sell-off intensifies
articles.summary: A spike in long-term yields following Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's election commitment to reduce food taxes exposed that vulnerability. Japan's 30- and 40-year bond rates reached new highs after rising by more than 25 basis points.

articles.title: What India Inc wants from Budget 2026: Cost relief, faster execution, policy clarity
articles.summary: Ahead of Budget 2026, leaders like Nirmala Sitharaman, Aparna Reddy, Abhimanyu Munjal and Prashant Mathur urge targeted fiscal support, faster execution and cost rationalisation for growth.

articles.title: India’s core sector growth hits four-month high in December, led by cement and steel
articles.summary: Eight core industries grew 3.7% in December, up from 2.1% in November, with cement and steel output rising sharply. Crude oil and natural gas production continued to decline.

articles.title: SEBI Chairman dismisses FPI exit fears, says outflows cyclical; registration, netting reforms coming soon
articles.summary: SEBI Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey said recent foreign portfolio investor outflows are cyclical and modest relative to the scale of overseas investments in India, while outlining upcoming reforms to speed up FPI registration, ease KYC frictions and introduce netting to improve market efficiency.

articles.title: Economists warn debt and geopolitics cloud fragile global recovery: WEF report
articles.summary: Global growth expectations have stabilised, but chief economists surveyed by the World Economic Forum warn that rising debt, narrowing fiscal space and shifting trade flows are creating new fault lines across economies.

articles.title: SEBI chair drops hints on key market reforms coming soon
articles.summary: SEBI Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey signalled a series of changes aimed at making Indian markets more efficient and accessible. From easing processes for foreign investors to tweaks in trading systems, several reforms could be closer than expected.

articles.title: US announces trade deal with Taiwan, cuts tariff to 15% in exchange of $250 billion investment
articles.summary: In response, the US has capped tariffs on Taiwanese auto parts, timber, lumber and wood derivative products at 15%. Generic Pharma and ingredients manufactured in Taiwan will attract zero tariff, according to the Commerce Ministry statement.

articles.title: India’s National Statistical Commission at a crossroads
articles.summary: The Parliamentary Standing Committee flags gaps in India’s National Statistical Commission, urging statutory authority, audits, and harmonisation to restore credibility and ensure reliable data for policymaking and public trust.

articles.title: India’s exports rise in first nine months of FY26, trade deficit widens beyond $25 billion
articles.summary: India’s exports grew 4.3% in April–December 2025 to $634.26 billion, led by smartphones and key markets, even as the trade deficit widened to over $25 billion.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh sees AI-led growth opportunities outweighing headwinds
articles.summary: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh at Davos said AI is driving growth, with over 90 percent top clients engaged in AI projects. Financial services and energy sectors show improving demand.

articles.title: Sony Cedes Control of Bravia TVs to China’s TCL Electronics
articles.summary: Sony Group Corp. will sell a 51% stake in its home entertainment arm, including Bravia TVs, to TCL Electronics Holdings Ltd., forming a joint venture starting April 2027.

articles.title: BCCI bags ₹270 crore AI sponsorship deal for IPL
articles.summary: BCCI secures a ₹270 crore sponsorship from Gemini for IPL 2026, highlighting AI platforms' rising interest. Tata Group holds IPL title rights, while ChatGPT sponsors the Women’s Premier League.

articles.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang looks to reopen China market, plans another visit to country
articles.summary: Huang frequently travels to China during this time of year, and this visit coincides with a critical juncture for the most valuable firm in the world. The US is allowing Nvidia to sell its H200 model in the Asian country by easing export limits on AI processors.

articles.title: Dalmia Bharat Q3 Results: Sales volume growth of 10% beats estimates, margins a miss
articles.summary: Dalmia Bharat reported sales volumes of 7.3 million tonnes during the December quarter, 10% higher than the 6.7 million tonnes reported last year. The CNBC-TV18 poll estimate had projected growth of 7%.

articles.title: Dhanlaxmi Bank Q3 Results: Profit, NII rises 20% YoY, asset quality improves
articles.summary: Dhanlaxmi Bank reported a 20% rise in Q3 profit and net interest income, aided by stronger loan growth and improving asset quality, with gross NPAs declining sequentially.

articles.title: Thangamayil Jewellery Q3 Results: Profit, revenue more than double; margin flat
articles.summary: Thangamayil Jewellery reported a sharp jump in Q3 earnings, with profit more than doubling year-on-year on strong revenue growth, even as operating margins remained largely stable.

articles.title: Shadowfax IPO Day 2: ₹1,900 crore issue subscribed 57% so far led by retail; Check GMP, other details
articles.summary: Bengaluru-based ShadowFax plans to use ₹423 crore from the fresh issue of shares to fund its capital expenditure plans, which include expansion of first-mile, last-mile and sorting facilities.

articles.title: Supreme Industries Q3 Results: Management cuts margin guidance for FY26; stock volatile
articles.summary: In an interaction with CNBC-TV18, Managing Director MP Taparia said that the full year margins are now seen between 13.5% to 14% from 14.5% to 15% projected earlier.

articles.title: SRF shares fall over 6% after management cites 'persistent pressure' from Chinese competitors
articles.summary: Brokerages such as Jefferies, Citi, and Morgan Stanley remain bearish on the stock and have projected a downside of as much as 24.5% from current levels for shares of SRF.

articles.title: Suryoday Small Finance Bank enters gold loan segment, begins rollout from Maharashtra
articles.summary: Suryoday Small Finance Bank launches gold loans in Maharashtra, aiming to expand secured lending nationwide using its 700 outlets, led by Baskar Babu Ramachandran.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu Elections 2026: AMMK rejoins NDA, TTV Dhinakaran meets Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: The NDA, led by the AIADMK in alliance with the BJP, will seek to challenge the ruling DMK-Congress combine in the upcoming Tamil Nadu Assembly polls 2026. Read on:

articles.title: West Bengal SIR: Supreme Court issues directions to Election Commission
articles.summary: To ensure accountability, the Supreme Court directed election officials to certify the receipt of documents and the conduct of hearings. The West Bengal government was instructed to provide adequate manpower to assist the Election Commission during the process.

articles.title: PM Modi to launch ₹830 cr infra push in Bengal's Singur today
articles.summary: PM Modi visits West Bengal, inaugurates projects worth over ₹830 crore in Hooghly, launches electric catamaran, new rail lines, and flags off Amrit Bharat Express trains amid BJP-TMC rivalry.

articles.title: Two women, related to gangster & jailed in murder case, win Pune civic polls
articles.summary: Sonali Vanraj Andekar and Lakshmi Udaykant Andekar are candidates of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) faction led by Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.

articles.title: PMC Election Results 2026: Ward-wise list of winning candidates in Pune Municipal Corp polls
articles.summary: BJP leading in 90 of 122 declared wards in PMC elections; NCP, Shiv Sena trail behind

articles.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad PCMC Election Results: BJP leads in 83 seats, NCP ahead in 37
articles.summary: The BJP is leading in 83 seats in Pimpri-Chinchwad, while Ajit Pawar's NCP is ahead in 37 seats in Pimpri-Chinchwad. Meanwhile, the Shiv Sena leads by seven seats.

articles.title: BMC Election Results 2026: Ward-wise list of winning candidates in Mumbai
articles.summary: BMC election counting shows BJP-led Mahayuti alliance leading in over 115 wards, Shiv Sena (UBT) trailing, and notable wins for Nishikant Govind Shinde and Khairunisa Akbar Husain.

articles.title: BJP to announce new national president on Jan 20; Nitin Nabin front-runner
articles.summary: If elected, Nabin will succeed JP Nadda, who has held the post since January 2020. Notably, Nadda had also followed a similar trajectory, having first been appointed as the BJP’s national working president in June 2019. Read on:

articles.title: Navi Mumbai civic election results: BJP is leading in 66 seats, Shiv Sena in 42
articles.summary: As per the figures available, the BJP is ahead in 66 seats, while the Shiv Sena (Shinde) is leading in 42 seats. Shiv Sena (UBT) is leading in two seats and MNS in one

articles.title: Indians face more US visa refusals on social media scrutiny
articles.summary: Indians are facing increasing temporary US visa refusals under section 221(g), with stricter background checks, social media vetting, and scrutiny of old arrest records causing delays. Even applicants with valid documents are affected, and appointments are being pushed to later in the year. The process now requires additional documents, slowing visa approvals further.

articles.title: Meta 'turning a blind eye' to illegal gambling ads, UK Gambling Commission says

articles.title: OpenAI CFO says annualised revenue crosses $20 billion in 2025
articles.summary: OpenAI chief financial officer Sarah Friar ‍said in a blog ​post on Sunday the company's annualized ⁠revenue has surpassed $20 billion in 2025, up from $6 billion in 2024 with growth closely tracking an expansion in computing ‌capacity.

articles.title: Kerala: CM Vijayan opens his State’s work-near-home facility at Kollam

articles.title: UK, France mull social media bans for youth as debate rages
articles.summary: Countries including France and Britain are considering following Australia's lead by banning children and some teenagers from using social media, but experts are still locked in a debate over the effectiveness of the move. France is currently debating bills for a similar ban for under-15s, including one championed by President Emmanuel Macron.

articles.title: RMZ, Andhra Pradesh Govt ink strategic pact to enable up to $10 billion in investments

articles.title: Ignore gold's message at your peril

This surge in gold's value is linked to political instability and economic uncertainty. Central banks worldwide increased their gold purchases, seeking protection. The article highlights gold's historical role as a hedge against inflation and currency depreciation during turbulent times.

articles.title: RBI Guv Malhotra calls for high standards of governance in urban co-op banks

articles.title: Provide incentive in Budget for R&D, create specialised fin institution for long-term fund: MPC member Nagesh Kumar
